title: push: goes top down, need bottom up for web ui stats updates
body:
In this brave new world decided to give a shot to push on my regular update of datasets.datalad.org, and spotted that
```shell
(git)smaug:/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl[master]git
$> datalad push '--since=^' --to=datalad-public -r --data auto  
publish(ok): . (dataset) [refs/heads/master->datalad-public:refs/heads/master 6bf9121..41e9bf7]                                                                                                                                                                    
publish(ok): abide2 (dataset) [refs/heads/master->datalad-public:refs/heads/master b181e7f..f7486d4]                                                                                                                                                               
publish(ok): abide2/RawData (dataset) [refs/heads/master->datalad-public:refs/heads/master 6c0ab6e..d595725]                                                                                                                                                       
publish(ok): abide2/RawData/BNI_1 (dataset) [refs/heads/git-annex->datalad-public:refs/heads/git-annex 6211913..2dab00c]    
...
```
it goes from super dataset down to subdatasets.  
I am yet to check if there is some reason for that, but I know that it would interfere with web-ui functioning in "pulling up" the file stats for web UI: it relies on super-dataset seeing already up-to-date subdatasets whenever its `post-update` hook is run -- the only way AFAIK to have file stats efficiently pulled up the tree upon updates.

So I wonder if it could be may be flipped to go bottom-up or if not, may be there should be an option (yet another thing to remember) or configuration item (but then would need to be set in all subdatasets, uff)
